record.field: OBSTETRIC DYSTOCIA/RISK OF LOSS OF FETAL WELFARE

BLADDER CATHETERIZATION AND ANTIBIOTIC PROPHYLAXIS. PFANENSTIEL INCISION. ABDOMINAL WALL OPENING BY LAYERS. TRANSVERSE SEGMENTAL HYSTEROTOMY. EXTRACTION OF THE CRYING FETUS IN THE SURGICAL FIELD. UMBILICAL CORD CLAMPING. EXTRACTION OF PLACENTA, REVISION OF THE CAVITY WITH GAUZE. CONTINUOUS HYSTERORRHAPHY VYCRIL 1. CLOSURE OF THE CAVITY BY PLANES. COUNTING SURGICAL MATERIAL.

-START TOLERANCE 6 HOURS AFTER SURGERY. -METAMIZOLE 1 AMPOULE/8H. -METOCLOPRAMIDE IF NAUSEA OR VOMITING, 1 AMP/8H. - PARACETAMOL 1GR IV/8H, IF RESCUE IS NEEDED. -OMEPRAZOLE 20MG 1 VIAL/24H. -START AMBULATION -REMOVE BLADDER CATHETER AFTER 24 HOURS. -MONITOR DRAINAGE AND VITAL SIGNS

- YOUR USUAL TREATMENT, THE SAME. - IF PAIN, PARACETAMOL 650MG, 1 TABLET/8H. IF PAIN INCREASES, ALTERNATE WITH NOLOTIL 575MG 1 TABLET/8H. - KEEP THE WOUND CLEAN AND DRY - DAILY DRESSING OF THE WOUND WITH ANTISEPTIC AND REMOVAL OF STITCHES/SHRINKAGE WITHIN 10 DAYS AT THE HEALTH CENTER - RELATIVE REST FOR TWO WEEKS - IN CASE OF FEVER OR CLINICAL WORSENING, GO TO THE HEALTH CENTER EMERGENCY ROOM.
UNDER LOCAL ANESTHESIA, TRIAMCIANOLONE IS INFILTRATED AND THE KELOID IS RESECTED LEAVING ITS BORDERS, CLOSURE WITH NON-ABSORBABLE MONOFILAMENT. REMOVAL OF ALTERNATE STITCHES FROM THE 10TH DAY.

- YOUR USUAL TREATMENT, AS ABOVE - IF PAIN, PARACTEAMOL 650MG 1 TABLET/8H. IF PAIN INCREASES, ALTERNATE WITH NOLOTIL 575MG 1 TABLET/8H. - KEEP THE WOUND CLEAN AND DRY - DRESS THE WOUND DAILY WITH ANTISEPTIC AND REMOVE STITCHES/SHRINKAGE WITHIN 10 DAYS AT THE HEALTH CENTER
INGUINAL APPROACH (SAID, LEFT, BILATERAL). INGUINAL CANAL OPENING. EPIDURAL ORCHIDOPEXY ACCORDING TO SCHOEMAKER'S TECHNIQUE, CANAL CLOSURE BY PLANES. INTRADERMAL SKIN WITH VICRYL RAPID 4)0.
START TOLERANCE WHEN WIDE AWAKE IF PAIN PARACETAMOL SYRUP 20 MG/KG
IF PAIN PARACETAMOL 15 MG/KG EVERY 6 HOURS REST FOR 5 DAYS KEEP WOUNDS DRY AND CLEAN DAILY DRESSING WITH ANTISEPTIC NO NEED TO REMOVE STITCHES SAME AS GENERAL FORM
AFTER ANESTHETIC INFILTRATION, EXODONTIA OF THE TEETH IS PERFORMED. ALVEOLAR CURETTAGE AND VICRYL SUTURE.

- START TOLERANCE 4 HOURS AFTER SURGERY - COLD DIET - AUGMENTINE 1 G IV / 8 H - PARACETAMOL 1GR IV / 8H. - (PRN) METAMIZOL 1 AMPOULE/8H. - (PRN) METOCLOPRAMIDE IF NAUSEA OR VOMITING - OMEPRAZOLE 40MG 1 VIAL/24H - VITAL SIGNS CONTROL

YOUR USUAL TREATMENT, SUCH AS - AUGMENTIN 875 1/ 8H 5 DAYS - IF PAIN, PARACTEAMOL 650MG 1 TABLET/8H. IF PAIN INCREASES, ALTERNATE WITH NOLOTIL 575MG 1 TABLET/8H. - DIET DOUX - IF FEVER OR CLINICAL WORSENING, GO TO EMERGENCY - CHECK-UP NEXT ___ AT ___ AT ____.
PERIAREOLAR APPROACH. EXERESIS OF FIBROADENOMA . CLOSURE BY PLANES WITH INTRADERMAL SUTURE. REFERRED FOR HISTOPATHOLOGICAL STUDY.

- START TOLERANCE 4 HOURS AFTER SURGERY - PARACETAMOL 1GR IV/8H - (PRN) METAMIZOLE 1 AMPOULE/8H. - (PRN) METOCLOPRAMIDE IF NAUSEA OR VOMITING - OMEPRAZOLE 40MG 1 VIAL/24H - INITIATE AMBULATION - MAINTAIN COMPRESSIVE BANDAGE 24 HS - CONTROL OF DRAINAGE AND VITAL SIGNS

- YOUR USUAL TREATMENT, AS ABOVE - IF PAIN, PARACTEAMOL 650MG 1 TABLET/8H. IF PAIN INCREASES, ALTERNATE WITH NOLOTIL 575MG 1 TABLET/8H. - KEEP THE WOUND CLEAN AND DRY - DAILY DRESSING OF THE WOUND WITH ANTISEPTIC AND REMOVAL OF STITCHES/SHRINKAGE WITHIN 10 DAYS AT THE HEALTH CENTER - RELATIVE REST FOR ONE WEEK - IF FEVER OR CLINICAL WORSENING, GO TO THE EMERGENCY ROOM - CHECK-UP NEXT ___ AT ___ AT ____.
START TOLERANCE WHEN WIDE AWAKE IF PAIN PARACETAMOL SYRUP 20 MGRS/KILO
IF PAIN PARACETAMOL SYRUP 20 MGRS/KILO/8 HOURS WASH PENIS WITH SALINE OR SOAP AND WATER. KEEP WOUND DRY AND CLEAN ANTISEPTIC EVERY 24 HOURS

- YOUR USUAL TREATMENT, THE SAME. - IF PAIN, PARACETAMOL 650MG, 1 TABLET/8H. IF PAIN INCREASES, ALTERNATE WITH NOLOTIL 575MG 1 TABLET/8H. - KEEP THE WOUND CLEAN AND DRY - DRESS THE WOUND DAILY WITH ANTISEPTIC AND REMOVE STITCHES/SHRINKAGE WITHIN 10 DAYS AT THE HEALTH CENTER - IN CASE OF FEVER OR CLINICAL WORSENING, GO TO THE HEALTH CENTER EMERGENCY ROOM.
CAUTERIZATION OF DISTAL GRANULOMA OF THE 2ND FINGER LEFT HAND.

SUBCUTANEOUS AND MUSCULAR PLANE APPROACH. DISSECTION OF RIGHT HEMITHYROID, PREVIOUS IDENTIFICATION AND PRESERVATION OF RIGHT SUPERIOR AND INFERIOR PARATHYROID GLANDS, AND RIGHT LARYNGEAL RECURRENT NERVE. RIGHT SUBTOTAL HEMITHYROIDECTOMY, PRESERVING THE REMNANT OF THE RIGHT THYROID LOBE. DISSECTION OF LEFT HEMITHYROID, PREVIOUS IDENTIFICATION AND PRESERVATION OF LEFT SUPERIOR AND LEFT INFERIOR PARATHYROID GLANDS, AND LEFT LARYNGEAL RECURRENT NERVE. LEFT HEMITHYROIDECTOMY. REVISION OF HEMOSTASIS. CLOSURE BY PLANES. SKIN WITH INTRADERMAL SUTURE.

-STARTING TOLERANCE 4 HOURS AFTER SURGERY -PARACETAMOL 1GR IV/8H. -(PRN) METAMIZOLE 1 AMPOULE/8H. -(PRN) METOCLOPRAMIDE IF NAUSEA OR VOMITING -OMEPRAZOLE 40MG 1 VIAL/24H. -START AMBULATION -REMOVE BLADDER CATHETER -MONITOR DRAINAGE AND VITAL SIGNS

- YOUR USUAL TREATMENT, AS ABOVE - IF PAIN, PARACTEAMOL 650MG 1 TABLET/8H. IF PAIN INCREASES, ALTERNATE WITH NOLOTIL 575MG 1 TABLET/8H. - KEEP THE WOUND CLEAN AND DRY - DRESS WOUNDS DAILY WITH ANTISEPTICS AND REMOVE STITCHES WITHIN 10 DAYS AT THE HEALTH CENTER - REST FOR ONE WEEK - IF FEVER OR CLINICAL WORSENING, GO TO THE EMERGENCY ROOM - CHECK-UP NEXT ___ AT ___ AT ____.

SUBCUTANEOUS AND MUSCULAR PLANE APPROACH. DISSECTION OF RIGHT HEMITHYROID, PREVIOUS IDENTIFICATION AND PRESERVATION OF RIGHT SUPERIOR AND INFERIOR PARATHYROID GLANDS, AND RIGHT LARYNGEAL RECURRENT NERVE. RIGHT SUBTOTAL HEMITHYROIDECTOMY, PRESERVING THE REMNANT OF THE RIGHT THYROID LOBE. DISSECTION OF LEFT HEMITHYROID, PREVIOUS IDENTIFICATION AND PRESERVATION OF LEFT SUPERIOR AND LEFT INFERIOR PARATHYROID GLANDS, AND LEFT LARYNGEAL RECURRENT NERVE. LEFT HEMITHYROIDECTOMY. REVISION OF HEMOSTASIS. CLOSURE BY PLANES. SKIN WITH INTRADERMAL SUTURE.

-STARTING TOLERANCE 4 HOURS AFTER SURGERY -PARACETAMOL 1GR IV/8H. -(PRN) METAMIZOLE 1 AMPOULE/8H. -(PRN) METOCLOPRAMIDE IF NAUSEA OR VOMITING -OMEPRAZOLE 40MG 1 VIAL/24H. -START AMBULATION -REMOVE BLADDER CATHETER -MONITOR DRAINAGE AND VITAL SIGNS

- YOUR USUAL TREATMENT, AS ABOVE - IF PAIN, PARACTEAMOL 650MG 1 TABLET/8H. IF PAIN INCREASES, ALTERNATE WITH NOLOTIL 575MG 1 TABLET/8H. - KEEP THE WOUND CLEAN AND DRY - DRESS WOUNDS DAILY WITH ANTISEPTICS AND REMOVE STITCHES WITHIN 10 DAYS AT THE HEALTH CENTER - REST FOR ONE WEEK - IF FEVER OR CLINICAL WORSENING, GO TO THE EMERGENCY ROOM - CHECK-UP NEXT ___ AT ___ AT ____.
IDENTIFICATION OF HEMORRHOIDAL BUNDLES IS PERFORMED AT THE ... HEMORRHOIDECTOMY IS PERFORMED ACCORDING TO MILLIGAN-MORGAN TECHNIQUE. REVIEW OF HEMOSTASIS.

- START TOLERANCE 4 HOURS AFTER SURGERY - PARACETAMOL 1GR IV/8H - (PRN) METAMIZOLE 1 AMPOULE/8H. - (PRN) METOCLOPRAMIDE IF NAUSEA OR VOMITING - OMEPRAZOLE 40MG 1 VIAL/24H - INITIATE AMBULATION - REMOVE BLADDER CATHETER - CONTROL OF DRAINAGE AND VITAL SIGNS

- YOUR USUAL TREATMENT, AS ABOVE - IF PAIN, PARACTEAMOL 650MG 1 TABLET/8H. IF PAIN INCREASES, ALTERNATE WITH NOLOTIL 575MG 1 TABLET/8H. - DUPHALAC ONE SACHET EVERY 12 HOURS. - CLEAN AND DRY THE WOUND. - WASH DAILY WITH SOAP AND WATER. - RELATIVE REST FOR ONE WEEK - RETURN TO THE CLINIC AFTER 1 WEEK. - IF THE WOUND BECOMES HOT OR IF PUS COMES OUT OF THE WOUND, RETURN IMMEDIATELY TO THE CLINIC.
PARINGUINAL INCISION. OPENING OF THE OBLIQUE APONEUROSIS. DISSECTION AND RELEASE OF HERNIAL SAC. HERNIOPLASTY WITH POLYPROPYLENE MESH. CLOSURE BY PLANES.

- START TOLERANCE 4 HOURS AFTER SURGERY - PARACETAMOL 1GR IV/8H - (PRN) METAMIZOLE 1 AMPOULE/8H. - (PRN) METOCLOPRAMIDE IF NAUSEA OR VOMITING - OMEPRAZOLE 40MG 1 VIAL/24H - INITIATE AMBULATION - REMOVE BLADDER CATHETER - CONTROL OF DRAINAGE AND VITAL SIGNS

- YOUR USUAL TREATMENT, AS ABOVE - IF PAIN, PARACTEAMOL 650MG 1 TABLET/8H. IF PAIN INCREASES, ALTERNATE WITH NOLOTIL 575MG 1 TABLET/8H. - KEEP THE WOUND CLEAN AND DRY - DRESS WOUNDS DAILY WITH ANTISEPTICS AND REMOVE STITCHES/SCARS WITHIN 10 DAYS AT THE HEALTH CENTER. -DO NOT WORK FOR 1 MONTH. - IF THE WOUND BECOMES HOT OR IF PUS COMES OUT OF THE WOUND, RETURN IMMEDIATELY TO THE CLINIC. - RETURN TO THE CLINIC AFTER 1 WEEK.
INGUINAL APPROACH (RIGHT, LEFT, BILATERAL). INGUINAL CANAL OPENING.HERNIORRHAPHY CLOSING SAC WITH VICRYL 2/0. CLOSURE BY FERGUSON PLANES. INTRADERMAL SKIN VICRYL RAPID 4/0.
INITIATE TOLERANCE WHEN WIDE AWAKE PARACETAMOL SYRUP 20 MGRS/KILO
IF PAIN, PARACETAMOL SYRUP 15 MG/6 HOURS WOUND DRESSING WITH ANTISEPTIC EVERY 24 HOURS NO NEED TO REMOVE SUTURES
INFRAUMBILICAL INCISION. DISSECTION OF THE HERNIA SAC. CLOSURE OF THE DEFECT WITH VICRYL 2/0 CLOSURE BY SKIN PLANES LOOSE STITCHES VICRYL RAPID 4/0
START TOLERANCE WHEN WIDE AWAKE IF PAIN PARACETAMOL DOSE 20 MGRS/KILO
IF PAIN, PARACETAMOL 15 MGRS/6 HOURS KEEP WOUND DRY AND CLEAN. REMOVE DRESSING IN 72 HOURS. CURE EVERY 24 HOURS WITH AN ANTISEPTIC NO NEED TO REMOVE SUTURE
INGUINAL APPROACH (LEFT, LEFT, BILATERAL). INGUINAL CANAL OPENING. VAGINAL PERITONEAL DUCT CLOSURE WITH VICRYL 2/0. RESIDUAL HYDROCELE EMPTYING. CLOSURE BY PLANES. INTRADERMAL SKIN VICRYL RAPID 4/0.
START TOLERANCE WHEN WIDE AWAKE IF PAIN PARACETAMOL SYRUP 20 MGRS/KILO
IF PAIN, PARACETAMOL SYRUP 15 MGRS/KILO/6 HOURS KEEP WOUND DRY AND CLEAN CURE WITH ANTISEPTIC EVERY 24 HOURS NO SUTURE REMOVAL NECESSARY

SCROTAL INCISION AND IDENTIFICATION OF THE HYDROCELE SAC. THE SAC IS OPENED AND THE VAGINAL IS PARTIALLY EVULSED BY PLICATION OF THE VAGINA (LORD TECHNIQUE). THE VAGINAL IS DISSECTED AND EVECTED (JABOULAY'S TECHNIQUE). THE VAGINAL IS DISSECTED AND RESECTED (ANDREWS TECHNIQUE).

- MAINTAIN COMPRESSIVE BANDAGE - START TOLERANCE 4 HOURS AFTER SURGERY - PARACETAMOL 1GR IV/8H - (PRN) METAMIZOL 1 AMPOULE/8H. - (PRN) METOCLOPRAMIDE IF NAUSEA OR VOMITING - OMEPRAZOLE 40MG 1 VIAL/24H - DIURESIS CONTROL - CONTROL OF DRAINAGE AND VITAL SIGNS

- YOUR USUAL TREATMENT, AS ABOVE - IF PAIN, PARACTEAMOL 650MG 1 TABLET/8H. IF PAIN INCREASES, ALTERNATE WITH NOLOTIL 575MG 1 TABLET/8H. - KEEP THE WOUND CLEAN AND DRY - DRESS WOUNDS DAILY WITH ANTISEPTICS - RELATIVE REST FOR A WEEK - KEEP TESTICLE ELEVATED WITH A SHELL - IF FEVER OR CLINICAL WORSENING, GO TO EMERGENCY - CHECK-UP NEXT ___ AT ___ AT ____.

ANTIBIOTIC PROPHYLAXIS. BLADDER CATHETERIZATION. PFANENSTIEL INCISION OR INFRAUMBILICAL MEDIAN LAPAROTOMY. ABDOMINAL WALL OPENING BY PLANES, PLS OF ROUND LIGAMENTS, PLS OF UTERO-OVARIAN LIGAMENTS, DESCENT OF BLADDER PLICA, PLS OF UTERINE VESSELS, PARAMETRIUM. COLPOTOMY. SURGICAL PIECE EXTRACTION. COLPORRHAPHY. CAVITY CLOSURE BY PLANES.

- START TOLERANCE 6 HOURS AFTER SURGERY - METAMIZOL 1 AMPOLL/8H, 24 HOURS. - (PRN) METOCLOPRAMIDE IF NAUSEA OR VOMITING. - PARACETAMOL 1GR IV/8H IF NEEDED. - OMEPRAZOLE 20MG 1 VIAL/24H - INITIATE AMBULATION - REMOVE BLADDER CATHETER - CONTROL OF DRAINAGE AND VITAL SIGNS

- YOUR USUAL TREATMENT, THE SAME. - IF PAIN, PARACETAMOL 650MG, 1 TABLET/8H. IF PAIN INCREASES, ALTERNATE WITH NOLOTIL 575MG 1 TABLET/8H. - KEEP THE WOUND CLEAN AND DRY - DAILY DRESSING OF THE WOUND WITH ANTISEPTIC AND REMOVAL OF STITCHES/SHRINKAGE WITHIN 10 DAYS AT THE HEALTH CENTER - RELATIVE REST FOR TWO WEEKS - IN CASE OF FEVER OR CLINICAL WORSENING, GO TO THE HEALTH CENTER EMERGENCY ROOM.

ANTIBIOTIC PROPHYLAXIS. BLADDER CATHETERIZATION. VAGINAL INFILTRATION. ANTERIOR PLASTY PREPARATION. VESICOUTERINE SPACE DISSECTION. PLS UTEROSACRAL LIGAMENTS, PLS PARACOLPIUM, PLS UTERINE VESSELS, PLS UTERO-OVARIAN LIGAMENTS. COLPOPERINEOPLASTIES. COLPORRHAPHY. MCCALL COLPOSUSPENSION.

- START TOLERANCE 6 HOURS AFTER SURGERY - METAMIZOLE 1 AMPOULE/8H. - (PRN) METOCLOPRAMIDE IF NAUSEA OR VOMITING. - PARACETAMOL 1GR IV/8H IF NEEDED. - OMEPRAZOLE 20MG 1 VIAL/24H. - INITIATE AMBULATION - WITHDRAW VESICAL NURSE AT 24 HOURS - CONTROL OF DRAINAGE AND VITAL SIGNS

- YOUR USUAL TREATMENT, AS ABOVE - IF PAIN, PARACETAMOL 650MG 1 TABLET/8H. IF PAIN INCREASES, ALTERNATE WITH NOLOTIL 575MG 1 TABLET/8H. - KEEP THE WOUND CLEAN AND DRY - DAILY VAGINAL WASH WITH SOAP - REST FOR ONE WEEK - IN THE EVENT OF FEVER OR CLINICAL WORSENING, GO TO A HEALTH-CARE CENTER EMERGENCY ROOM
PARTIAL FREE SKIN GRAFT IS TAKEN AND APPLIED TO THE DEFECT. FIXATION WITH AGRAFES AND KNOTTED DRESSING.

- YOUR USUAL TREATMENT, AS ABOVE - IF PAIN, PARACTEAMOL 650MG 1 TABLET/8H. IF PAIN INCREASES, ALTERNATE WITH NOLOTIL 575MG 1 TABLET/8H. - KEEP THE WOUND CLEAN AND DRY, REMOVE THE DRESSING AFTER 5 DAYS AT THE HEALTH CENTER.
A SPINDLE INCISION WAS MADE, WITH DISSECTION AND REMOVAL OF THE TUMOR, WHICH WAS SENT FOR HISTOPATHOLOGICAL STUDY. CLOSURE BY PLANES.

- START TOLERANCE 4 HOURS AFTER SURGERY - PARACETAMOL 1GR IV/8H - (PRN) METAMIZOLE 1 AMPOULE/8H. - (PRN) METOCLOPRAMIDE IF NAUSEA OR VOMITING - OMEPRAZOLE 40MG 1 VIAL/24H - INITIATE AMBULATION - REMOVE BLADDER CATHETER - CONTROL OF DRAINAGE AND VITAL SIGNS

- YOUR USUAL TREATMENT, AS ABOVE - IF PAIN, PARACTEAMOL 650MG 1 TABLET/8H. IF PAIN INCREASES, ALTERNATE WITH NOLOTIL 575MG 1 TABLET/8H. - KEEP THE WOUND CLEAN AND DRY - DAILY DRESSING OF THE WOUND WITH ANTISEPTIC AND REMOVAL OF STITCHES/SHRINKAGE WITHIN 10 DAYS AT THE HEALTH CENTER - RELATIVE REST FOR ONE WEEK - IF FEVER OR CLINICAL WORSENING, GO TO THE EMERGENCY ROOM - CHECK-UP NEXT ___ AT ___ AT ____.

PFANNNSTIEL INCISION, WALL OPENING, MYOMA INFILTRATION WITH BUPIVACAINE AND 0.5% ADRENALINE. OPENING OF THE MYOMA CAPSULE UNTIL ENTRY INTO THE CLEAVAGE PLAN. DISSECTION OF MYOMA BY COUNTERTRACTION TRACTION TECHNIQUE. EXTRACTION OF THE MYOMA AND SUTURE OF THE MYOMA BED WITH LOOSE STITCHES OF VYCRIL 2/0. THE DYNAMIC IS REPEATED WITH EACH MYOMA. SUTURE OF THE SEROSA WITH CONTINUOUS SUTURE PDS 2/0. CLOSURE OF THE SKIN WOUND CAVITY WITH STAPLES.

- START TOLERANCE 6 HOURS AFTER SURGERY - PARACETAMOL 1GR IV/8H. - METAMIZOLE 1 AMPOULE/8H. - (PRN) METOCLOPRAMIDE IF NAUSEA OR VOMITING - OMEPRAZOLE 40MG 1 VIAL/24H - INITIATE AMBULATION - REMOVE BLADDER CATHETER - CONTROL OF DRAINAGE AND VITAL SIGNS

- YOUR USUAL TREATMENT, AS ABOVE - IF PAIN, PARACETAMOL 650MG 1 TABLET/8H. IF PAIN INCREASES, ALTERNATE WITH NOLOTIL 575MG 1 TABLET/8H. - KEEP THE WOUND CLEAN AND DRY - DAILY DRESSING OF THE WOUND WITH ANTISEPTIC AND REMOVAL OF STITCHES/SHRINKAGE WITHIN 10 DAYS AT THE HEALTH CENTER - RELATIVE REST FOR ONE WEEK - IN CASE OF FEVER OR CLINICAL WORSENING, GO TO THE EMERGENCY DEPARTMENT.

- MASTECTOMY STEWARD HORIZONTAL INCISION. DISSECTION AND SUPERIOR SKIN FLAP TO THE INFERIOR BORDER OF THE CLAVICLE. DISSECTION AND INFERIOR SKIN FLAP TO SURPASS THE SUBMAMMARY SULCUS AND REACH THE INSERTION OF THE OBLIQUES AND ANTERIOR RECTUS ABDOMINIS. DISSECTION OF THE MAMMARY GLAND WITHOUT INCLUDING PREPECTORAL FASCIA.
- CONSERVATIVE SURGERY INCISION IS MADE _________ DISSECTION OF UPPER AND LOWER SKIN FLAP AND BLOCK EXCISION OF TUMOR UP TO THE LEVEL OF PREPECTORAL FASCIA. BREAST ONCOPLASTY, CLOSURE OF SUBCUTANEOUS TISSUE AND SKIN WITH INTRADERMAL.
- LYMPHADENECTOMY AXILLARY LYMPHADENECTOMY IS PERFORMED EN BLOC IDENTIFYING FIRST THE OUTER EDGE OF THE PECTORALIS MAJOR AND OPENING OF THE AXILLARY FASCIA, THEN THE ANTERIOR EDGE OF THE LATISSIMUS DORSI IS LOCATED AND AFTER THAT THE ANTERIOR AND INFERIOR FACE OF THE AXILLARY VEIN IS IDENTIFIED AND RELEASED. IDENTIFICATION OF THE LONG THORACIC NERVE OR BELL'S NERVE AND THE THORACO-DORSAL VASCULO-NERVE BUNDLE THAT IS RESPECTED. AXILLARY DRAINAGE
- MODIFIED RADICAL MASTECTOMY MADDEN TYPE 1ST STAGE: STEWARD HORIZONTAL INCISION. DISSECTION AND SUPERIOR SKIN FLAP TO THE INFERIOR BORDER OF THE CLAVICLE. DISSECTION AND INFERIOR SKIN FLAP TO SURPASS THE SUBMAMMARY SULCUS AND REACH THE INSERTION OF THE OBLIQUES AND ANTERIOR RECTUS ABDOMINIS. DISSECTION OF THE MAMMARY GLAND AND PECTORALIS FASCIA PRESERVING BOTH PECTORALIS MUSCLES. 2ND STAGE: AXILLARY LYMPHADENECTOMY IS PERFORMED EN BLOC AND IDENTIFIED.

-STARTING TOLERANCE 4 HOURS AFTER SURGERY -PARACETAMOL 1GR IV/8H. -(PRN) METAMIZOLE 1 AMPOULE/8H. -(PRN) METOCLOPRAMIDE IF NAUSEA OR VOMITING -OMEPRAZOLE 40MG 1 VIAL/24H. -START AMBULATION -REMOVE BLADDER CATHETER - MAINTAIN COMPRESSIVE DRESSING -MONITOR DRAINAGE AND VITAL SIGNS
PALATAL FISSURE CLOSURE IN THREE PLANES, BY CARVING PALATAL FLAPS AND REPOSITIONING THE MUSCULATURE BY INTRA-VELAR VELOPLASTY TYPE III 1 BARDACH'S TECHNIQUE 2 INTRAVELAR VELOPLASTY TYPE III

-START TOLERANCE WITHIN 4 HOURS OF SURGERY - LIQUID/SHREDDED DIET - URBASON 40-60 MG7 24H -PARACETAMOL 1GR IV/8H -(PRN) METAMIZOLE 1 AMPOULE/8H. -(PRN) METOCLOPRAMIDE IF NAUSEA OR VOMITING - AUGMENTINE 1GR IV / 8 H -OMEPRAZOLE 40MG 1 VIAL / 24H.

- KEEP WOUND CLEAN AND DRY - SOFT DIET 7 DAYS - PARACETAMOL 1 G/8H 5 DAYS - AUGMENTIN 875/8H 5 DAYS - METAMIZOLE IF NECESSARY 1 COMPR / 8H - IN CASE OF FEVER OR WORSENING CLINICAL CONDITION, GO TO EMERGENCY. - SEE YOU NEXT ___ AT ___ AT ____
PALATAL FISSURE CLOSURE IN THREE PLANES, BY CARVING PALATAL FLAPS AND REPOSITIONING THE MUSCULATURE BY INTRA-VELAR VELOPLASTY TYPE III 1 BARDACH'S TECHNIQUE 2 INTRAVELAR VELOPLASTY TYPE III
- START TOLERANCE 4 HOURS AFTER SURGERY - LIQUID/SHREDDED DIET - IBUPROFEN 30 MG7K7DAY - AUGMENTIN 30-50 MG/K/DAY - URBASON

- KEEP WOUND CLEAN AND DRY - SOFT DIET 7 DAYS - AUGMENTIN 30-50 MG/K/DAY 5 DAYS - IF NECESSARY IBUPROFEN 30 MG/K/DAY OR PARACETAMOL 15 MG/K/6 HOURS - IF FEVER OR CLINICAL WORSENING, GO TO EMERGENCY - CHECK-UP NEXT ___ AT ___ AT ____
MODIFIED BLAIR INCISION, DISSECTION OF THE FACIAL NERVE AND EXCISION OF THE TUMOR. CLOSURE BY PLANES, LEAVING ASPIRATED DRAINAGE.

- START TOLERANCE 4 HOURS AFTER SURGERY - PARACETAMOL 1GR IV/8H. - (PRN) METAMIZOLE 1 AMPOULE/8H. - (PRN) METOCLOPRAMIDE IF NAUSEA OR VOMITING - OMEPRAZOLE 40MG 1 VIAL/24H - CONTROL OF DRAINAGE AND VITAL SIGNS

- YOUR USUAL TREATMENT, AS ABOVE - IF PAIN, PARACTEAMOL 650MG 1 TABLET/8H. IF PAIN INCREASES, ALTERNATE WITH NOLOTIL 575MG 1 TABLET/8H. - KEEP THE WOUND CLEAN AND DRY - DRESS WOUNDS DAILY WITH ANTISEPTICS AND REMOVE STITCHES/SHRINKAGE WITHIN 10 DAYS AT THE HEALTH CENTER - RELATIVE REST FOR ONE WEEK - IF FEVER OR CLINICAL WORSENING, GO TO THE EMERGENCY ROOM - CHECK-UP NEXT ___ AT ___ AT ____.

- START TOLERANCE 4 HOURS AFTER SURGERY - LIQUID/SHREDDED DIET - AUGMENTIN 30-50 MG/K/DAY - IBUPROFEN 30 MG/K/DAY - URBASON

- KEEPING THE INJURY CLEAN AND DRY - LIQUID/SHREDDED DIET NEXT 7 DAYS - AUGMENTINE 30-50 MG/K/DAY, 5 DAYS - IF NECESSARY, IBUPROFEN 30 MG/K/DAY OR PARACETAMOL 15MG/K/6HRS - CHECK-UP NEXT ___ AT ___ AT ____
LIP FISSURE CLOSURE WITH FUNCTIONAL REPOSITIONING OF THE MUSCULATURE. UNILATERAL FISSURE CLOSURE ACCORDING TO MILLARD TECHNIQUE 2. BILATERAL FISSURE CLOSURE ACCORDING TO MULLIKEN TECHNIQUE.
- START TOLERANCE 4 HOURS AFTER SURGERY - LIQUID/SHREDDED DIET - URBASON 40-60 MG/24H - PARACETAMOL 1 G IV/8H - (PRN) METAMIZOLE 1 AMPOULE/8H. - OMEPRAZOLE 40MG /24H - AUGMENTINE 1 G IV/8H

- KEEPING THE WOUND CLEAN AND DRY - LIQUID / SHREDDED DIET FOR 7 DAYS - PARACETAMOL 650MG 1COMP/8H - (PRN) METAMIZOLE 1 COMP /8H. - AUGMENTINE 875/125 EVERY 8H, 5 DAYS - CHECK-UP NEXT ___ AT ___ AT ____

ANTIBIOTIC PROPHYLAXIS. BLADDER CATHETERIZATION. PFANNENSTIEL INCISION / INFRAUMBILICAL MEDIAN LAPAROTOMY. ABDOMINAL WALL OPENING BY LAYERS. EXCISION OF OVARIAN CYST OR TUMOR AFTER CAPSULE DISSECTION. HEMOSTASIS STITCHES. CAVITY CLOSURE BY LAYERS.

- START TOLERANCE 6 HOURS AFTER SURGERY - METAMIZOLE 1 AMPOULE/8H. - (PRN) METOCLOPRAMIDE IF NAUSEA OR VOMITING. - PARACETAMOL 1GR IV/8H IF RESCUE IS NEEDED. - OMEPRAZOLE 40MG 1 VIAL/24H. - INITIATE AMBULATION - REMOVE BLADDER CATHETER - CONTROL OF DRAINAGE AND VITAL SIGNS

- YOUR USUAL TREATMENT, AS ABOVE - IF PAIN, PARACETAMOL 650MG 1 TABLET/8H. IF PAIN INCREASES, ALTERNATE WITH NOLOTIL 575MG 1 TABLET/8H. - KEEP THE WOUND CLEAN AND DRY - DAILY DRESSING OF THE WOUND WITH ANTISEPTIC AND REMOVAL OF STITCHES/SHRINKAGE WITHIN 10 DAYS AT THE HEALTH CENTER - RELATIVE REST FOR TWO WEEKS - IN THE EVENT OF FEVER OR CLINICAL WORSENING, GO TO THE HEALTH CENTER EMERGENCY ROOM
INFILTRATION WITH VASOCONSTRICTOR ANESTHESIA, INCISION IN ORAL MUCOSA OF .............A .............CYSTECTOMY AND EXODONTIA OF THE AFFECTED TEETH. HEMOSTASIS AND SUTURE WITH VICRYL.

- START TOLERANCE 4 HOURS AFTER SURGERY - LIQUID DIET - PARACETAMOL 1GR IV/8H - (PRN) METAMIZOLE 1 AMPOULE/8H. - (PRN) METOCLOPRAMIDE IF NAUSEA OR VOMITING - OMEPRAZOLE 40MG 1 VIAL/24H - AUGMENTIN 875 /8H
